Dear {!Contact.Name},
<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" />
In accordance to Resolution 850, Paragraph 14.1 the airline may withdraw from a given BSP by serving written notice of not less than three (3) and not more than thirteen (13) months. Therefore, to process your request please forward the official notification of the Airline's intention to withdraw from the BSP.
You can use the attached template letter for your reference.
The notification must:
· Be on an official company letterhead
· Signed by a designated signatory
· State the termination date
The original document must be sent to:
International Air Transport Association
Airline Participation 33, Route de l’Aeroport P.O. Box 416 1215 Geneva 15 Airport, Switzerland
Please do not hesitate to contact this office in case of any further queries/assistance that may be required with regards to the above. Our team will be glad to assist you accordingly.
For future support in regards to any other query, please log a new inquiry through our customer portal at http://www.iata.org/customer-portal/Pages/contactus.aspx
Thank you!
{!Case.OwnerFullName}
Global Airline Participation Team
Industry Distribution and Financial Services
International Air Transport Association
33, Route de l'Aéroport
1215 Geneva 15 Airport
Switzerland
